Material used.Material Name: Differentiated SH-SY5Y cells overexpressing WT or A53T alpha-synuclein and control cells
Material used.Description: Cells were used to compare proteomic profiles between WT, A53T, and control conditions.

description.effect: A53T mutation is associated with altered proteomic profiles, including changes in HSPA9, NDUFS1, DLAT, and ATP5A1 expression.

Experiment Method.Replicates: Not explicitly stated, but standard biological replicates are assumed.
Experiment Method.Statistical Analysis: ANOVA for comparing proteomic profiles between groups.

Thresholds.normal: Standard thresholds for proteomic changes (e.g., ≥1.5-fold change in protein abundance) are assumed.
Thresholds.abnormal: Significant deviations from control proteomic profiles are considered abnormal.

Material used.Material Name: Protein extracts from SH-SY5Y cells overexpressing WT or A53-T alpha-synuclein
Material used.Description: Used for identifying specific proteins differentially expressed in A53T versus WT conditions.

description.effect: A53T mutation is associated with identification of 63 differentially expressed proteins, with 77% of changes observed in WT samples.

Experiment Method.Replicates: Not explicitly stated, but standard technical replicates are assumed.
Experiment Method.Controls: Control samples from cells without alpha-synuclein overexpression.

Thresholds.normal: Standard thresholds for protein identification (e.g., ≥95% confidence in peptide identification) are assumed.
Thresholds.abnormal: Proteins with significant differential expression (e.g., ≥1.5-fold change) are considered abnormal.

Material used.Material Source: Protein extracts from SH-SY5Y cells overexpressing WT or A53T alpha-synuclein
Material used.Description: Used to validate proteomic findings for specific proteins.

description.effect: A53T mutation is associated with altered expression levels of HSPA9, NDUFS1, DLAT, and ATP5A1.

Experiment Method.Replicates: Not explicitly stated, but standard biological replicates are assumed.
Experiment Method.Controls: Control samples from cells without alpha-synuclein overexpression.
Experiment Method.Statistical Analysis: ANOVA for comparing protein expression levels between groups.

Thresholds.normal: Standard thresholds for Western blot (e.g., 50–100% of control expression) are assumed.
Thresholds.abnormal: Significant deviations from control (e.g., <30% or >150% of control) are considered abnormal.
